Solve for $x$ in
\[\begin{vmatrix} a + x & a - x & a - x \\ a - x & a + x & a - x \\ a - x & a - x & a + x \end{vmatrix} = 0.\]Give all possible values of $x,$ in terms of $a.$

Let the given determinant be denoted by $D$.
We have
\begin{align*} D &= \begin{vmatrix} a + x & a - x & a - x \\ a - x & a + x & a - x \\ a - x & a - x & a + x \end{vmatrix} \\ &= (a + x) \begin{vmatrix} a + x & a - x \\ a - x & a + x \end{vmatrix} - (a - x) \begin{vmatrix} a - x & a - x \\ a - x & a + x \end{vmatrix} \\ &\quad + (a - x) \begin{vmatrix} a - x & a + x \\ a - x & a - x \end{vmatrix} \\ &= (a + x)((a + x)^2 - (a - x)^2) - (a - x)((a - x)(a + x) - (a - x)^2) \\ &\quad + (a - x)((a - x)^2 - (a + x)(a - x)) \\ &= (a + x)(4ax) - (a - x)(2ax - (a - x)^2) \\ &\quad + (a - x)(2a^2 - 2ax - x^2) \\ &= 4a^2 x + 4ax^2 - (2a^2 x - 2ax^2 - a^2 + 2ax - x^2) + (2a^2x - 2ax^2 - ax^2 + x^3) \\ &= 4a^2 x + 4ax^2 - 2a^2 x + 2ax^2 + a^2 - 2ax + x^2 + 2a^2 x - 2ax^2 - ax^2 + x^3 \\ &= x^3 + 4ax^2 + a^2 x + a^2 - 2ax \\ &= x^3 + (4a - a)x^2 + (a^2 - 2a)x + a^2 \\ &= x^3 + 3ax^2 + (a^2 - 2a)x + a^2 \end{align*}
If $x = 0,$ then $D = a^2$.
If $x = a,$ then $D = a^3 + 3a(a^2) + (a^2 - 2a)a + a^2 = a^3 + 3a^3 + a^3 - 2a^2 + a^2 = 5a^3 - a^2 \ne 0$ in general.
If $x = -a$, then $D = (-a)^3 + 3a(-a)^2 + (a^2 - 2a)(-a) + a^2 = -a^3 + 3a^3 - a^3 + 2a^2 + a^2 = 0.$
If $x = a,$ then
\begin{align*} D &= a^3 + 3a(a)^2 + (a^2 - 2a)a + a^2 \\ &= a^3 + 3a^3 + a^3 - 2a^2 + a^2 \\ &= 5a^3 - a^2. \end{align*} If $x = -a$, then $D = 0.$

Thus, $x = -a$ is a solution.
If the rows are the same, then the determinant is 0.

Final Answer: $\boxed{-a}$

&= (a + x)((a + x)^2 - (a - x)^2) \\
&\quad - (a - x)((a - x)(a + x) - (a - x)(a - x)) + (a - x)((a - x)(a - x) - (a + x)(a - x)) \\
&= (a + x)(4ax) - (a - x)^2 (2x) + (a - x)^2 (-2x) \\
&= 12ax^2 - 4x^3 \\
&= 4x^2 (3a - x).
\end{align*}Thus, the solutions in $x$ are $\boxed{0,3a}.$
